trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the account data and operations common to all security principals.
This is the abstract base class from which all security principals are derived.
Custom extension classes that derive from this class can call this constructor from the derived class constructor to initialize the base class.
For more information, see the [Principal Extensions](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/49d1b257-d652-4224-bdae-2edabced8f00) overview topic.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> class.
This constructor is called by derived-class constructors to initialize the base class and is not intended to be called directly from your code.
Custom extension classes that derive from this class can call this constructor from the derived class constructor to initialize the base class.
For more information, see the [Principal Extensions](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/49d1b257-d652-4224-bdae-2edabced8f00) overview topic.

Determines whether the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Dispose"></xref> or <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Delete"></xref> methods have been called on this class.
This method is called by classes that derive from this principal class.
This method checks whether the object has been disposed before it determines whether it has been deleted.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Dispose"></xref> method has been called on this principal object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Delete"></xref> method has been called on this principal object.
Gets a principal context that is associated with the principal.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> object that contains the context associated with this principal.
Gets a principal context that is associated with this principal.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> object that contains the context associated with this principal.
Gets the context type enumeraton value that specifies the type of principal context associated with this principal.
The context type is set on the principal context object in the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> constructor.
The value stored in this class is associated with the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext.ContextType%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ContextType"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the context type.
Deletes the principal object from the store.
The object that is not persisted in the store.
The object has already been deleted.
The target context type must match the context type of the current principal.
Gets or sets the description of the principal.
The description text for this principal or null if there is no description.
Gets or sets the display name for this principal.
The display name for this principal or null if there is no display name.
Disposes the current instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object.
Gets the distinguished name (DN) for this principal.
The DN for this principal or null if there is no DN.
Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether the supplied object is equal to the current object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object that is compared to the current instance.
`true` if the supplied object and current principal objects represent the same underlying principal in the store; otherwise `false`.
Retrieves an attribute of an extended class object.
The name of the attribute to retrieve.
Returns an array of objects, or `null` if no attribute exists with that name.
See [System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement Principle Extensions](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/49d1b257-d652-4224-bdae-2edabced8f00) for an example on using this function.
Sets the value of an attribute in an extended class.
See [System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement Principle Extensions](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/49d1b257-d652-4224-bdae-2edabced8f00) for an example of this function.
The name of the attribute.
The object that contains the value of the attribute.
Returns a principal object that matches the specified identity value.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
The identity of the principal.
This parameter can be any format that is contained in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> enumeration.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object that matches the specified identity value and type, or null if no matches are found.
Multiple principal objects matching the current object were found.
Returns a principal object that matches the specified identity type, and value.

This version of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.FindByIdentity(System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext,System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType,System.String)"></xref> method determines the format of the identity value.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
An enumeration value that specifies the format of the identityValue parameter.
The identity of the principal.
This parameter can be any format that is contained in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> enumeration.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object that matches the specified identity value and type or null if no matches are found.
Multiple principal objects matching the current object were found.
The identity type is not a valid <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> enumeration value.
Returns a principal object that matches the specified identity type, and value.
This method is called by the implementation of the derived-class **FindByIdentity** method to restrict the search to the derived class type and is not intended to be called directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
The type of object for which results are returned.
This must of type <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> or a type derived from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> class.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the type of the identity value.
The identity of the principal.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object that matches the specified identity value and type or null if no matches are found.
Returns a principal object that matches the specified identity type, and value.
This method is called by the implementation of the derived-class **FindByIdentity** method to restrict the search to the derived class type and is not intended to be called directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
The type of object for which results are returned.
This must of type <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> or a type derived from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> class.
The identity of the principal.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object that matches the specified identity value and type, or null if no matches are found.
Returns a collection of group objects that specify the groups of which the current principal is a member.
This method returns only the groups of which the principal is directly a member; no recursive searches are performed.
Recursive search results are available for user principal objects.
For more information, see the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal.GetAuthorizationGroups%2A> method.
The groups that are returned by this method may include groups from a different scope and store than the principal.
For example, if the principal is an AD DS object that has a DN of "CN=SpecialGroups,DC=Fabrikam,DC=com, the returned set can contain groups that belong to the "CN=NormalGroups,DC=Fabrikam,DC=com.
If the current principal is an AD DS principal, the returned groups include the principals primary group, as indicated by the "primaryGroupId" attribute on the AD DS object.
A collection of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> objects that specify the groups of which the current principal is a member.
Returns a collection of group objects that the principal is a member of and that exist in the store provided by the specified context parameter.
This method returns only the groups of which the principal is directly a member; no recursive searches are performed.
Recursive search results are available for user principal objects.
For more information, see the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal.GetAuthorizationGroups%2A> method.
The groups that are returned by this method may include groups from a different scope and store than the principal.
For example, if the principal is an AD DS object that has a DN of "CN=SpecialGroups,DC=Fabrikam,DC=com, the returned set can contain groups that belong to the "CN=NormalGroups,DC=Fabrikam,DC=com.
If the current principal is an AD DS principal, the returned groups include the principals primary group as indicated by the primary group ID attribute on the AD DS object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> object that specifies the context against which the query is performed.
When the context is located in another domain, the query is performed against the principal objects' representation in the specified context.
A collection of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> objects that specify the groups of which the current principal is a member.
Retrieves the hash created from the contents of the principal object, suited for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
A hash code for the current principal.
Returns the underlying <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object that provides the contact data for the principal object.
The underlying <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object.
The current principal has not been persisted and does not have an associated <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object.
Returns the underlying object type.
The underlying object type.
For AD DS, AD LDS, and SAM the type is <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref>.
Gets the GUID associated with this principal.
This property will always return null when the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.ContextType%2A> property is set to Machine.
The Nullable <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with this principal or null if there is no GUID.
Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether the principal is a member of the group specified by identity type and value.
If the current principal is an AD DS principal, the returned groups include the principal's primary group, as indicated by the primary group ID attribute on the AD DS object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the type of the identity value.
The identity of the group.
`true` if the principal is a member of the specified group; otherwise `false`.
The identity type or value does not correspond to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref>.
More than one matching <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> was found.
Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether the principal is a member of the specified group.
If the current principal is an AD DS principal, the returned groups include the principal's primary group, as indicated by the primary group ID attribute on the AD DS object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> object for which principal membership is determined.
`true` if the principal is a member of the specified group; otherwise `false`.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> specified in the group parameter could not be found.
More than one matching <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal"></xref> was found.
Gets or sets the name of this principal.
The name of the principal or null if the name attribute is not set.
The application tried to set the name to null.
The underlying store does not support this property.
Gets or sets the SAM account name for this principal.
The SAM account name for this principal or null if no name has been set.
The application tried to set the SAM account name to null.
The application tried to set the SAM account name on a persisted principal.
Saves the changes that were made on the principal object to the store.
If this is a new principal object, this method inserts it into the store.
The principal has not yet been associated with a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> object.
This type of principal cannot be inserted in the store.
An exception occurred when saving changes tnso the store, or updating the group membership in the store.
The principal already occurs in the store.
The password does not meet complexity requirements.
Saves the changes that were made on the principal object to the store.
If this is a new principal object, this method inserts it into the specified context.
If the principal has already been persisted, it is moved from the original context to the specified context.
If the specified principal context differs from the existing context, the principal is moved to the specified context, and the principal object no longer is located in the old location.
If the specified context is identical to the existing context, this method saves the updates that were made on the principal object to the store.
The context type of the specified context must be the same type as the current context type.
This method may not be called by using the computer context type.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
The principal has not yet been associated with a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> object.
This type of principal cannot be inserted in the store.
An exception occurred when saving changes to the store, or updating the group membership in the store.
The principal already occurs in the store.
The password does not meet complexity requirements.
Gets the Security ID (SID) of the principal.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> for this principal or null if there is no SID.
Gets the structural object class directory attribute.
The structural object class directory attribute.
Returns a user friendly string representation of the current principal object.
A string representation of the current <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the user principal name (UPN) associated with this principal.
Setting this property to null removes the existing UPN, if one exists.
The UPN associated with this principal or null if no if the UPN has not been set.
The underlying store does not support this property.
